(FORM 20.)
FORM OF A MEDICAL CERTIFICATE.
Lt Col A. J. Alexander, of the 11th Regiment of Ky Vol Cavalry having applied for a certificate on which to ground an application for leave of absence ^withdrawl of resignation^, I do hereby certify that I have carefully examined this officer, and find that from a personal observation the he is suffering from Internal heemorhoids in a sever form, but by prompt treatment it is my opinion that he could be made able for field duty in Thirty or Forty Days He is under treatment now And that, in consequence thereof, he is, in my opinion, unfit for dity. I further declare my belief that he will not be able to resume his duties in a less period than
Dated at Louisville Ky., this 23d day of June 1864.

John A Brody
Ast Surgeon U. S. A
In charge Officer Hospital

MEDICAL CERTIFICATE
IN THE CASE OF
Lt. Col A. J. Alexander
11th Regt Ky Vol Cavalry
Given at Louisville Ky
BY
John A. Brady
Ast Surgeon U. S. A
Rec'd, A. G. O., , 186.
